doc.content: Jack Bradley, 6, proudly showed off the pinch marks on his arm he got collecting crabs for the classroom tank he and classmates at Midland Elementary School were exploring last week. The Rye second-grade students were learning about marine life by observing and handling specimens they collected at the Edith Read Sanctuary and by reading about sea creatures at the school library and on the Internet. When the students are finished with their observations, the fish and crabs will be returned to the sanctuary. "Next summer, when I go to the beach with my dad, I'll know how to look for hermit crabs, green crabs and minnows," Jack said.
